update.description:
This pull request adds the backend implementation for:

  1. Rewind: The simulation starts from the beginning.
  1. Forward: The simulation jumps to the end of the log file.
  1. Seek: The simulation jumps to a specific point specified by its simulation time.

There's still no easy way to test it until we have all the GUI changes merged. This is how you can do it:

Replace `MainWindow.cc::Step()` with this snippet:


```
#!c++
void MainWindow::Step()
{
  msgs::LogPlaybackControl msg;
  msg.set_rewind(true);
  this->logPlaybackPub->Publish(msg);
}

```

Declare and advertised the topic before with:

```
this->logPlaybackPub =
    this->node->Advertise<msgs::LogPlaybackControl>("~/playback_control");
```


You can replace the line `msg.set_rewind(true);` with other options:

  1. Forward:

```
msg.set_forward(true);
```
 
 1. Seek: 

```
  msg.mutable_seek()->set_sec(<VALUE_IN_SIM_SECS>);
  msg.mutable_seek()->set_nsec(<VALUE_IN_SIM_NSECS>);
```

Probably, the next pull request will be a new `gazebo::test::ServerFixture::Lload()` function that can load a world from a log file. Then, we could add a few tests for the functionality added in this pull request.

Test results:

1. [No GPU is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/356/).
1. [Trusty GPU is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/276/).
1. [Homebrew is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/263/).
update.title: Log playback: rewind, forward, seek

update.title: Log playback: rewind, forward, seek

content.raw: Not sure if it's a good idea, but how about treating forward as a "seek to the log end time"? Then we wouldn't have a `forwardPending` and no need to use a huge `stepInc`.
content.html: Not sure if it's a good idea, but how about treating forward as a "seek to the log end time"? Then we wouldn't have a forwardPending and no need to use a huge stepInc.

content.raw: Why do you use a mutex here when updating `stay` but not below?
content.html: Why do you use a mutex here when updating stay but not below?

content.raw: It's much better now! There's only one little weird thing described below.
content.html: It's much better now! There's only one little weird thing described below.

content.raw:
I'm experiencing something weird. This works:

1. Start the playback paused

1. Forward (it takes a while and jumps to the end, ok)

1. Rewind (it quickly jumps back tot he beginning, ok)

But this fails:

1. Start the playback paused

1. Forward (it takes a while and jumps to the end, ok)

1. Play (nothing happens because it is in the end of the file, ok)

1. Rewind (nothing happens, it seems to be stuck in the end)
content.html:
I'm experiencing something weird. This works:

  1. Start the playback paused

  2. Forward (it takes a while and jumps to the end, ok)

  3. Rewind (it quickly jumps back tot he beginning, ok)

But this fails:

  1. Start the playback paused

  2. Forward (it takes a while and jumps to the end, ok)

  3. Play (nothing happens because it is in the end of the file, ok)

  4. Rewind (nothing happens, it seems to be stuck in the end)

update.title: Log playback: rewind, forward, seek

content.raw: This is to force the step of the first chunk of the log file and see some feedback. Otherwise, we wouldn't see anything unless the user step or hit play after rewind.
content.html: This is to force the step of the first chunk of the log file and see some feedback. Otherwise, we wouldn't see anything unless the user step or hit play after rewind.

content.raw: Fixed in 74d35e8
content.html: Fixed in 74d35e8

content.raw:
I've integrated this pull request with the GUI on branch [playback_gui_seek](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/playback_gui_seek%0Dlog_goto#diff).

One thing I noticed is the if you go forward or seek to a time in the future, the simulation keeps running normally until it hits that time. This is different from the multistepping behaviour, where the simulation "freezes" until the desired iteration is reached. Even if I pause the simulation before skipping to the future, if I hit play before the desired time is reached, the simulation keeps running until it gets there.
content.html:
I've integrated this pull request with the GUI on branch playback_gui_seek.

One thing I noticed is the if you go forward or seek to a time in the future, the simulation keeps running normally until it hits that time. This is different from the multistepping behaviour, where the simulation "freezes" until the desired iteration is reached. Even if I pause the simulation before skipping to the future, if I hit play before the desired time is reached, the simulation keeps running until it gets there.

content.html:

content.raw: We'll add the test in a separate pull request because it requires to create a new Load() method in `ServerFixture`. I don't think is possible right now to load a server within the test and playback a log file.
content.html: We'll add the test in a separate pull request because it requires to create a new Load() method in ServerFixture. I don't think is possible right now to load a server within the test and playback a log file.

```
  this->logPlaybackPub->Publish(msg);
}

```

Declare and advertised the topic before with:

```
this->logPlaybackPub =
    this->node->Advertise<msgs::LogPlaybackControl>("~/playback_control");
```


You can replace the line `msg.set_rewind(true);` with other options:

  1. Forward:

```
msg.set_forward(true);
```
 
 1. Seek: 

```
  msg.mutable_seek()->set_sec(<VALUE_IN_SIM_SECS>);
  msg.mutable_seek()->set_nsec(<VALUE_IN_SIM_NSECS>);
```

Probably, the next pull request will be a new `gazebo::test::ServerFixture::Lload()` function that can load a world from a log file. Then, we could add a few tests for the functionality added in this pull request.

Test results:

1. [No GPU is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/356/).
1. [Trusty GPU is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/276/).
1. [Homebrew is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/263/).
